text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with cold white bean and herb salad
that's right you may recognize these
beans from such recipe videos as root
beer glazed lamb ribs and i wanted to
show you this not only because it went
so perfectly with those ribs but also
because this may be the ultimate
last-minute summer side dish recipe idea
so let me show you how to put this
together and believe it or not this was
inspired by what many of us would
consider garbage so this is the bottom
half of a bunch of cilantro I used for a
different recipe and we're pretty much
left with some scraggly leaves around
the outside and a lot of stems and this
is the kind of thing a lot of people
would just throw away or you stick it in
the vegetable bin and then find it two
weeks later when it's become a science
experiment and throw it out then but
this cold bean recipe is a perfect way
to use this up so what we're gonna do is
we're gonna take a sharp knife and by
the way this has been thoroughly washed
and dried and we're just gonna start
shaving off the remaining leaves and all
those stems I know a lot of people don't
like cilantro but this works beautifully
with Italian parsley in fact I prefer it
so if you ever find yourself left with
the bottom of a bunch of parsley this
will work exactly the same but bottom
line we're gonna slice that up and then
we'll go down to the rest of the salad
which is unbelievably simple and easy I
have one rinsed and drained can of white
beans I believe these were sold as
cannellini beans which I think are the
same thing as white kidney beans but
don't quote me on it we're also gonna
add some optional and absolutely
mandatory minced garlic and then what
looks like cayenne but it's not it's
Aleppo pepper my new favorite pepper
so much you go to the blog post and read
about Aleppo pepper it's amazing at that
point we're gonna go ahead and dump in
our herbs and yes that is a lot the
ratio is like one part herb to two part
beans and you can even put more all
right with something like this there's
no such thing as too much herb but
anyway we're gonna dump that in and then
dress it with a very simple mustard
vinaigrette and for me that's just a
spoon of Dijon mustard some white
vinegar of any sort I'm using champagne
vinegar although it was made in
California so I'm pretty sure we're
supposed to call it sparkling wine
vinegar but pretty much any white
vinegar is gonna work we also want a
splash of olive oil and I'm gonna season
it up with some freshly ground black
pepper and salt of course and once you
mix that up thoroughly you're looking at
one of the great all-purpose summer side
dishes of all time and of course like
anything we make we're gonna taste it at
the end here adjust the seasoning as you
can see I decided to put in a little
more Aleppo pepper and of course you can
substitute cayenne as far as I'm
concerned you could substitute any
ingredient with cayenne it always works
and once that's mixed up you're done and
above and beyond being super fast and
easy and allowing us to use up what we
normally would throw away this will go
perfectly with all your favorite summer
foods ribs burgers brisket barbecue
chicken I mean I love those traditional
barbecue side dishes like baked beans
and potato salad but because this is
cold and has that kind of bracing
vinaigrette and all that fresh green
herb it really cuts through the richness
of those summer meats so for me this is
a perfect warm weather dish so I really
hope you give this a try head over to
food wishes comm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
